Package de.stocker.view

Class MainFrame

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • de.stocker.view.MainFrame
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants
    public class MainFrame
extends javax.swing.JFrame
    The Class MainFrame extends a JFrame, whose main part is a desktop pane for all the internal frame from the different parts of the application.
    Author:
    Matthias Rudolph
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void addToMainFrame​(javax.swing.JInternalFrame iFrame)
      Adds internal frame to the main frame's desktop pane.
      void bringToFront​(javax.swing.JInternalFrame f)
      Brings an internal frame to the front and sets focus.
      private void createAndShowGUI()
      Creates and shows the GUI, setting the look and feel for the application, automating the "Windows" menu, setting up the desktop pane and the closing routine to trigger the persistence.
      private void createMenus()
      Creates the menus.
      javax.swing.JInternalFrame[] getIFrames()
      Gets an array of all displayed internal frames.
      private void refreshWindowsMenu()
      Refreshes the "Windows" menu, generating an entry for every open internal frame.
      void resetDesktop()
      Resets the desktop pane, removing all frames.
